perturbation.original_text:
MAINTENANCE OF SOLVENCY. This provision applies only to benefits provided through the General Account. If the solvency of the Society
becomes impaired, you may be required to make an extra payment. The Board of Directors will determine the amount of any extra payment. It will
be based on each member’s fair share of the deficiency. You may make the extra payment by an equivalent reduction in benefits or by a payment in
cash. If you do not make the extra payment within 60 days from the date we notify you of your share of the deficiency, the amount will be charged
as an indebtedness against the contract with interest compounded at the rate of 5% per year.

perturbation.explanation: The 'Maintenance of Solvency' clause, which directly impacts the financial obligations of the contract holder, is moved into the 'Definitions' section. This is inappropriate because solvency maintenance isn't a definition; it's a condition that affects financial obligations. Placing it here obscures its importance and potential impact, making it less likely to be noticed or understood.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring clear and conspicuous disclosure of important financial terms.
